page.title: 03CANVEY METHANE TERMINAL
page.content: { The main entrance to the Methane Terminal is down Thames Road, on Canvey. To get in, you must go to the main entrance, where there is a security man, sitting inside a booth. He also controls cameras, so that he can see all around. I also saw an Alsatian dog running free in a compound. We were not able to get in because you must be 18 yrs. old. However, we walked along the sea wall,{behind}the Terminal. We saw the jetty which the Terminal owns. This is where ships come up the Thames and moor. The jetty sticks out into the deep water channel of the Thames. From the sea wall we saw many white storage tanks,with coloured flashes. The Terminal was well guarded by dogs and special barbed wire and cameras. They store gas there.
